sub_title: Artur Borejszo- associate @ Lola Landscape Architects
summary:
Artur Borejszo received master’s Degree and Architectural Engineering with distinction from the Technical University of Lodz, Poland.

Since 2009 he is a licensed architect in Netherlands. 

He is a guest lecturer and tutor at TU Delft and Rotterdamse Akademie van Bauwkunst.

Since May 2018 he is a senior designer – project leader / head of 3D design and visualisation at Lola Landscape Architects. He leads VO stage design for Bajes Kwartier in Amsterdam and Strategy for Resilient Landscape for AL Maktoum International Airport in Dubai. Next to it he coordinates Lola's BIM workflow with OMA and RHDHV for Feyenoord City. He is a senior designer for "Sport Park" in Shenzen, China, Gasklockan Project in Stockholm, Sweden

Between 2008-2018 as project leader & 3D design specialist at Maxwan architects + urbanists he focused on large scale urban design and landscape. Together with Rients Dijkstra and Hiroki Matsuura he worked on some of the largest masterplans in Europe. He lead office design team in several victories such as Imeretinka 2.0 Sochi, Skolkovo Gardens and led the execution of Skolkovo Gardens Park in Moscow

In 2014 he has established IMG+, a company that specializes in illustration and animation for urban, landscape and architectural design. He collaborated with: HERZOG & de MEURON, WEST8, NL ARCHITECTS, LOLA LANDSCAPE ARCHITECTS, DEZWARTEHOND, MVRDV, ECTOR HOOGSTAD, MLA+, B+B, FELIXX, CITYFOERESTER, WE ARCHITECTEN, THE CLOUD COLLECTIVE and more.

In 2012 he founded Impressively Simple, a company that served his individual design work in mix of fields of urban design, landscape and architecture. He won Europan 10 in Heildelberg and Europan 11 in Vienna, and his proposal for Svratka Riverfront competition was in top 5.

Between 2002–2007 as a designer at Frederick Gibson Architecture & Associates he was involved in design of exclusive housing, office and retail projects, from concept development to construction phase in USA and New Zealand.

Start of his proffesional carreer was in year 2000 as junior designer at Gorgul – Wisniewski Architektura I Urbanistyka in Łódź.

awards.title: 1st Price for Forest & Sports Park in Guang Ming, Shenzhen, China
awards.description:
Led by LOLA consortium, with TALLER (architecture) & L+CC (local support) won the international competition for a 600 hectare forest and sports park in Guang Ming, Shenzhen, China. The other competitors were JCFO, SWA and TCL. The jury praised the winning proposal for its fresh approach and being highly attentive to local ecology meanwhile incorporating romantic techniques and realistic urban functions. 

The forest and sports park is to become a destination for the Big Bay area. As this metropolitan region finds its success in innovative industries, the park focuses on innovation in sports and ecology. Two R&D centers, one for sports, one for botany are centrally located in the park. From here, a constant evolution and diversification of the park will take place. On the central park loop, a linear plant and tree nursery is integrated. In a natural forest setting, people will be able to get to know new and forgotten sports, as well as the latest techniques used in sports. A range from open valleys to lower hills and mountain forest offers the natural background for these sports and active leisure. 

An elevated path connects the park to the city and the forest; forming a scenic route that passes by all different types of forest. A series of pavilions, that host functions like restaurant, restroom, viewing platform and forest cabin, is modular an prefabricated, to minimize environmental impact.

awards.title: Second Place in competition for International Financial Center- IFC Moscow [2014]
awards.description: Maxwan in collaboration with TPO Reserve, Juurlink en Geluk, ARUP and Pegasus became finalist to develop the International Financial Centre (IFC) in Moscow! Among competitors: XDGA, KCAP, SOM, Gensler, MAD, ASTOC/HPP and Panerai. Beside Maxwan/Reserve,  only KCAP and ASTOC made it to the final round.

awards.title: 2nd prize in Zaryadye Park competition- Moscow [2013]
awards.description: Maxwan, together with TPO Reserve, Latz + Partner and Buro Happold was awarded with 2nd prize for designing the Zaryadye Park in the center of Moscow. Other finalists were West8, MVRDV, Diller & Scoffidio, Turenscape, and Gustafson Porter.

projects.title: 1st Price Winner: Skolkovo Gardens - Skolkovo Innovation Center, Moscow, Russia
projects.description: MAXWAN together with one of the best Russian landscape companies ARTEZA with the participation of MASA architects won the competition of 50ha park landscape design of Skolkovo Innovation Center in Moscow. This new park sits among a several prominent buildings designed by Herzog & de Meuron, Valode & Pistre, Gensler and Bernaskoni. Our team is rewarding a contract for all 3 stages of construction towards the realization starting on spring 2016

contributors.headline: Artur Borejszo- associate @ Lola Landscape Architects

projects.title: Moscow River 2035
projects.description:
Team Maxwan +Atrium + Juurlink en Geluk, including ARUP, PEGASUS was one of the finalists to develop vision for 80km of Moscow River. Project proposed set of strategies for next 20 years to improve 10,400 ha of land of different use along the river, as well as focused on 4 strategic sites.                                                                                                 All the ingredients desired to make up a vibrant waterfront metropolis already exist at the Moscow River; abundant nature, traces of history, monumental architecture and
spaces, well maintained embankments, the increasing quality of the water and a variety of unforgettably beautiful sceneries.
In the last century, Moscow, unconsciously, has not only been hiding these qualities from
the people, but has made the river itself an obstacle in the city, ironically due to the
development and the expansion of the city.
Now is the time to wake up this SLEEPING BEAUTY. The river and the treasures along it
have been hibernating in segregation, fragmentation and neglect. We are ready to bring the river back to the people. The recipe is: to make it tangible by making its shores accessible, to improve existing qualities and to make it part of the cities’ network.
We do not RE-CREATE the river. We REDISCOVERED it and now PUT IT CENTRE STAGE.

projects.title: International Financial Centre Moscow
projects.description:
Maxwan in collaboration with TPO Reserve, Juurlink en Geluk, ARUP and Pegasus are one of three finalists to develop the International Financial Centre (IFC) in Moscow!
In the next , and final stage, the client will hold commercial negotiations with the finalists in order to discuss their further participation in the implementation of the project. Other contestants being teams around: XDGA, KCAP, SOM, Gensler, MAD, ASTOC/HPP and Panerai. Beside Maxwan/Reserve, KCAP and ASTOC made it to the final round.

projects.title: Zaryadye Park - Moscow
projects.description:
The Zaryadye Park is located on a spectacular location: right in the heart of Moscow, beside the Kremlin, and only a stone throw away from the river Moskva. Being part of a UNESCO heritage area, it is surrounded by numerous historical monuments. In our design proposal the park is the connector of all these sites, binding the Red Square to the Green Square Saint Elias and both to the river. 
Our aim is to create a timeless park which has great value for centuries to come; a park that enhances the existing heritage rather than competing with it; a park that is informal and dynamic adapting to future trends, rather than trendy and hip for a short while. 
Open spaces of different sizes and atmospheres are created. They allow for multiple park activities ranging from big public events to small intimate meetings. A wide variety of tree species, not only naturally encourages bio-diversity, but also brings seasonal highlights throughout the year, with a spectacle of colors from spring to autumn.
The existing sloping landscape is transformed into four terraced levels, each level baring its own character and activity. 
New built facilities are located along a big ring serving as a simple and comfortable walking route, and integrated into the terraced landscape. 
Currently the park and the river are separated from each other by a six-lane road. In our design, we offer a wide passage under the road to a new grand waterfront venue. The building along the road serves as an anti-noise barrier for the park and creates a "belvedere" overlooking the River Moskva.

contributors.headline: Artur Borejszo- associate @ Lola Landscape Architects

projects.title: Red Hill Rise
projects.description:
Red Hill Rise, a mixed use building on top of a metro station, consists of offices and retail located along one of the major spine road connecting airport and historical city centre of Prague. Backdrop of the project is a dramatically steep slope (max. 14m height difference), the site being located in a tranquil residential area while required program is purely commercial and requires expressive architecture. Furthermore, there is a lack of sufficient public space in the neighborhood.

We came up with the idea of “breaking-up” the building volume and inserting landscape and public space in between. This approach is not only for being sensitive to the tranquil surroundings avoiding massive building volume, but also aiming for commercially competitive office space yet achieving expressive architecture.

contributors.headline: Artur Borejszo- associate @ Lola Landscape Architects

projects.title: Monolit - Baku
projects.description:
Monolit is one of the historical monuments in Baku. Currently the Monolit is in need of renovation and upgrading due to lack of sufficient maintenance and inflexible floor plans for contemporary program. This project aims at creating a new cultural and commercial point of gravity for Baku by renovation of the original Monolit and extension on the adjacent plot. 

The original Monolit will contain a public accessible courtyard garden, a roof garden and renovated apartments that provide new standards of living in Baku. The extension contains a mix of recreational, leisure and shopping programs with a generous underground parking. The hotel is for both international and domestic visitors, and the roof top terrace promises a great panoramic view of the city of Baku.

contributors.headline: Artur Borejszo- associate @ Lola Landscape Architects

projects.title: Potsdam
projects.description:
In our design for the new residential district in Bornstedter field form the history and existing qualities of the place, the basis for the design of a contemporary residential area.
Cars play in the field of secondary importance.
Where it is not necessary, therefore, the emphasis on the connection of people and places, and not by car is placed.
Where it is functionally possible, be minimized and road cross sections obtained streets an intimate character. This allows, in compliance with the requirement of a 15% public street space, the design of a large public connection space (red brick carpet) that connects the building of the Red Barracks with the People's Park, and at the same time provides the basis for the identity of the residential area.

contributors.headline: Artur Borejszo- associate @ Lola Landscape Architects

projects.title: Wadala Mumbai
projects.description:
° To achieve this it is paramount that the separate plots, containing either existing uses/buildings (Monorail Car Shed, Toll Tower, Truck Terminal), or new development (all other plots), are stitched together by a powerful, attractive backbone of streets and public spaces. The spine of this system is the new Central Street running North to South, parallel to Sewri Chembur Rd and ending at the salt pan/protected forest in the South. The spine has a set of 'arms', crossing the site East West to connect up with Dr Ambedkar Marg. 
° Guidelines for urban massing secure high quality frontage along this cross of streets. Building heights regulations are carefully chosen to secure best views from highest buildings, and to avoid overcrowding and mutual negative impact of higher buildings.
° Architectural guidelines should form part of the master plan with the aim of creating a clear identity and a visually calming unity.
Our practices promote the combination of a number of clearly defined, 'immutable' urban elements with a flexibility in built form and uses. The fixed element of the master plan is usually a combination of the main traffic infrastructure and public space design or design guidelines. A clear phasing strategy is part of this approach. The plan should be able to withstand periods of slow growth and changes in economy or uses. We wish to promote an approach that allows for flexible plot sizes, upper and lower limits of height (bandwidth), certain freedoms of massing and form within the typological constraints.

contributors.headline: Artur Borejszo- associate @ Lola Landscape Architects

projects.title: Aalto University
projects.description:
We see the competition as a chance to create more than merely adding a new space to shop and a place for a design school. We see it as a new front door for a new university: a complete campus center, including showcases for technology, business, and design; as well as places for urban activities, natural spaces and housing. 
The center should be a lively, inspirational place to work, to hang out and to live, with the backdrop of the rich nature of the area. It will be an open air exhibition of university life to current students, faculty members, visitors and prospective students.

As the campus stands now, it is a monotonous green space with buildings floating within it. For an overall campus strategy, the buildings should be clustered to form quads. In time, the green spaces between the buildings evolve to reflect a range of open space typologies.
Within this overall framework, Maxwan created numerous public space moments that can be used in different ways in different seasons by different people.
The design school is designed in a way that all spaces that can allow for more flexibility, openness, and a merging of making and educating, are pushed to the ground floor, while the more privacy/efficiency oriented programs – administration, classrooms, and LUME - are given a functional layout above. This creates a dynamic place to learn, and a showcase to passersby of the work of the school.

contributors.headline: Artur Borejszo- associate @ Lola Landscape Architects

projects.title: Groene Singel Antwerp
projects.description:
The City ring of Antwerp (Singel) is one of the five strategic areas, which play a key role in the urban development of the city. The basic objective of the Groene Singel project is to transform this strategic area, which today is underutilized, fragmented and marginal, into a new centrality of the city. In addition to open and green spaces, the area of the Groene Singel provides important building programs.
After a thorough selection process in January 2012, Maxwan in collaboration with Karres and Brands HUB and Goudappel Coffeng were appointed by the city planning authorities of Antwerp to develop design guidelines (BKP) for the ‘Strategic Space Groene Singel’. The plan describes the rules for landscapes, public spaces, infrastructures and buildings and defines sub-projects, which proactively will improve the image quality of the area. In addition, it is a handbook of guidelines for designers.
The formulated guidelines suit scale and complexity of the space of the Green Singel. They propose strategies taking into account current planning processes and limited resources of the client. The green of the Groene Singel is the driving constant of the plan: the creation of a powerful coherent ecological system by linking five major urban parks. Three different landscapes are developed into strong units of high visual quality. Throughout these three landscapes linear structures with a uniform image quality lie across the entire length of the Singel. Against the backdrop of the constants of landscape and infrastructure special buildings and outdoor areas are situated.

projects.title: Mechelen Boulevard
projects.description:
Maxwan A+U, in collaboration with Antea Group, won the international competition to redesign the primary shopping axis of the City of Mechelen, BE. It is one of the seven priority projects designated by the Flemish government to exemplify excellence in urban development in the coming years. It will be a three phase design and execution project, reconnecting central station and the main market square via an over 1km pedestrian boulevard.
The vision is to form a true central city axis, seamlessly integrating the various streets, knitting together the five major squares, and all the while maximizing space for green, water, bikes, and art. Pedestrian space is paramount, enlivening the shopping experience. The materials choice is envisioned to be simple, providing comfort and quality, allowing the users to be the highlight of the space. 
It will be a place to live, play, shop and stroll. This city gateway will reconnect Mechelen with its rich history and fulfill its ambition of becoming the most significant shopping boulevard in Flanders.

profile_positions.description:
In 2018 Artur joined Lola Landscape Architects, where he started with a senior role in the design team and is a leader for 3D design and visualization in the company.
The first big competition; Proposal for 600ha Forest & Sports Park in Guang Ming, Shenzen, China, in the office that he took responsibility for, received the 1st price. After the victory, he led the design team in SD and DD phases. Currently, the project is under construction.  
Next to it, Artur leads the design team for the development stage for public space design for Bajes Kwartier Masterplan in Amsterdam for VO and DO stages. Also, he leads the landscape design team for the terrain around the new airport terminal building in Dubai.
profile_positions.title: Project Leader

profile_positions.description:
IMG+ is a Rotterdam based visualisation & animation studio. It was founded by Artur Borejszo, Aleksandar Hrib, Rene Heijne, to establish a collaborative, creative team of experts.
We bring together knowledge of large scale master planning, architecture, landscape, infrastructure design with great skills and passion for architectural illustration, animation & graphic design.
Our quality comes from combination of technology, artistry, design and management experience. 
We specialise in explaining complex project in simple accessible and visually appealing way. Our kick-off task was a movie presenting transformation of Groene Singel in Antwerp, the we made for International Architecture Biennale Rotterdam 2014 on request of AG Stadsplanning Antwerpen.
We collaborate with design offices: HERZOG & de MEURON, WEST8, NL ARCHITECTS, LOLA LANDSCAPE ARCHITECTS, DEZWARTEHOND, MVRDV, ECTOR HOOGSTAD, MLA+, B+B, FELIXX, CITYFOERESTER, WE ARCHITECTEN, THE CLOUD COLLECTIVE and with developers: AM, Van Wonen, Lingotto, Oscar Properties and more.
profile_positions.title: Founding Partner / Owner

profile_positions.description: Impressively Simple is Artur's individual design studio with ambitious agenda that mixes various fields of design in it with focus on architectural, urban design. The name of the company comes from the jury report of Europan 11-Vienna competion where our project received 1st prize winner by unanimous vote. The jury report described our vision with words "impressively simple idea". This became a motto and the name for the company. Artur also received a 1st prize for Europan 10-Heidelberg and was in top 5 for Svratka Riverfront competition in Brno.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder / Owner

profile_positions.description:
In 2008, Artur joined Maxwan architects + urbanists. While working there together with Rients Dijstra and Hiroki Maatsura, Artur was involved in some of the largest urban projects in Europe, like BARKING RIVERSIDE MASTERPLAN or LEIDEN CENTRAL STATION. Next to it he leaded numerous competitions that received international acclaim like ZARYADYE PARK or MOSCOW RIVER, GENK, FOREST PARK 2.0- Moscow, NEO ZIL- Moscow, Tushino Triangle – Moscow, Parco Centrale di Prato and winning projects such as: IMERETINKA 2.0- Sochi, SKOLKOVO GARDENS- Moscow, MARSTALL PLATZ -Hannover. He led prestigious assignments like New Headquarter & Laboratory for Flemish Institute for Technological Research in Belgium, and leaded execution of key parts of SKOLKOVO GARDENS park in Moscow. Further on he was a key member of winning proposals such as: Cultured Meadow – Ostrava, Helsinki South Harbor – Helsinki, Machelen – Diegem Masterplan,  Tech City – Magdeburg, 
His extensive knowledge across the fields of digital graphics made him a 3D team leader, author of majority of visualizations and animations in the office.
profile_positions.title: Project Leader / Leader of  Visualisation & Animation
